1. Life-cj’cls of committees,
T ha^ this year asked all or most chairmen to react to the
idea of a possible three-vear rotation basis for committees.
This year’s chairman would retire next year, as would one
third of the members. Hach member would serve on a three-
year basis, in other words, with a rotating; chairmanship. A
vice-chairmanship would groom the person who would become next

This suggestion received mixed reactions. For this reason,
and others given above, it was not implemented this year. How
do you fe^l about it?
2. Below is a list of all committees and dr«aft definitions for
eacho Will all chairmen please react with a proposed redraft
of the definition of his committee please? (We’ve been trying
so many years — please do it now — and we’ll have it.) Will
chairmen and Board members, in this connection, please also
react to:
a) Possible overlapping of functions between committees,
with suggested corrections, which may have escaped us.
b) The size of committees.
c) An idea of how much of the committee’s task can be done
by mail and how much requires meetings 7-? How often?
Other needs? (If funds, suggest magnitude’)
d) Better ways of freeing chairmen, with initiative, to seek
support on behalf of the XA,;B.
e) What new committees do we need? In this connection, our
old Liaison Committee has been dropped; the former Foun¬
dation and/or Finance Committee is now the NAF.B Develop¬
ment Committee; legislative relations are handled by an
informal group, working with Leonard Marks; and the TV
and Kadio Planning Committees are being continued tenta¬
tively this year, on a trial run basis under the new
kadio and TV Board structure in the hope that this will
be helpful to the respective Boards in getting needed

the members of the 1959 committee.
f) Suggestions for good people we’ve missed, or people we’ve

mittees become action or project or ’’program” committees).
